name: Discretionary revocation or suspension of license by a court
text: In addition to the provisions for mandatory revocation of a license set forth in section 286-124, any court of competent jurisdiction may, in its discretion, revoke or suspend the license of any driver convicted of any felony in the commission of which a motor vehicle is used, or convicted of a violation of this part or of any traffic law or regulation of the State or any political subdivision thereof involving a vehicle in motion. [L 1937, c 234, §23; RL 1945, §7324; RL 1955, §160-56; HRS ; am L 1970, c 164, §3; am L 1971, c 171, §2]
